document.masterDocTitle: Further Indo-West Pacific palaemonoid shrimps (Crustacea: Decapoda: Palaemonoidea), principally from the New Caledonian region

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Further Indo-West Pacific palaemonoid shrimps (Crustacea: Decapoda: Palaemonoidea), principally from the New Caledonian region

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Palaemonopsis willeyi Borradaile 1899 , p 410
, Plates 36, 37, Figure 7 .

Amphipalaemon willeyi : Borradaile 1917 , p 407
, Plate 59, Figure 13 .

Specimens (iv)–(vii) are of the long-fingered second pereiopod type , (ix) with short fingers and in (ii) the fingers are subequal to the palm. The specimens (viii) may have been derived from sand-burrowing sponges rather than the eunicid tubes as this species is normally associated with sponges.

Type locality: Ralun , New Britain. Also known from Kenya, Zanzibar, Tanzania, Madagascar, Seychelles, Maldives , Singapore
,
South China
Sea , Philippines , Indonesia ( Borneo Bank )
,
Australia ( Northern Territory, Queensland ), and New Caledonia
.
